instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power and no green light
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no power and no green light. It has no signs of liquid damage, and no story.

I have <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>, but i don't have <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> (0V and 0.542 on diode reading).

On <RESISTOR>R5187</RESISTOR> I have 0V on <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>.

Shall I replace SMC?

TKS

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power and no green light
threads.message:
"I have <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>"
Strange that you don't consider <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> important to mention.

<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is controlled by <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power and no green light
threads.message:
Hi,

I forgoted to mention it. Sorry.

It was the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. After replacing it, it powers on again.

TKS!
